subject: Learning
title: Metacognitive Knowledge: Knowing Yourself as a Learner
description: One-minute skill: Metacognitive Knowledge: Knowing Yourself as a Learner.

hook.text: You know you learn math better in the morning and struggle with long readings. That's metacognitive knowledge.

buildup.text: It includes knowing your strengths, weaknesses, and which strategies work best for different tasks.

discovery.text: Expert learners have rich metacognitive knowledge. They know when to skim, when to reread, and when to practice.

twist.text: Novices often have inaccurate self-knowledgeâ€”they think they understand when they don't.

climax.text: Building accurate self-knowledge requires honest feedback and deliberate reflection after every learning session.

punchline.text: Know thyselfâ€”the oldest wisdom is the newest learning science.

quiz.question: What does metacognitive knowledge include?
options: Awareness of your own strengths, weaknesses, and effective strategies
